*div1 type="summary"* *p*Outline of address to convention by Austin, April 1, 1833.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*memorandum—*/p*
*p*1—A short general view of the political situation of the whole *location_mentioned*Mexican republic*/location_mentioned* in *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1832">November last*/date_mentioned*—all in revolution and so disorganized that it was not known in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*whether any legitimate government existed. Also a view of its present situation so far as is known and the tryumph of the *person_mentioned*liberal party*/person_mentioned* by the success of *person_mentioned*Santa Anna*/person_mentioned* and the pacification under the plan of *location_mentioned*Zavaleta*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*2—A short view of the situation of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*at that time owing to the revolution in *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*and the danger of falling into anarchy for the want of adequate *person_mentioned*local govt*/person_mentioned*, and the consequent necessity of doing something to preserve the public peace and order.*/p*
*p*3—Its present situation as to the administration of justice and all the departments of the *person_mentioned*local government*/person_mentioned*. The distance from the present seat of government its disimilarity from *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*in climate productions, situation, etc, etc.*/p*
*p*4—A general recapitulation shewing the necessity of a *person_mentioned*State government*/person_mentioned* to protect the rights of the *person_mentioned*natives*/person_mentioned*, as well as those of the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*5—As to the manner of applying for admission as a *location_mentioned*state of the Mexican confederation*/location_mentioned*—quote the law of *date_mentioned n="05-07-1824">7th May 1824*/date_mentioned*, as the basis of the right to petition for a *person_mentioned*state government*/person_mentioned* and conclude with the opinion that such a petition should be made accompanied with the project of a constitution to be drawn up in strict conformity in the national constitution—etc, etc.*/p*
*p*[Stephen F. Austin]*/p*
*/div1*
